Uses of Package
javaslang.control

  • Packages that use javaslang.control 
    Package Description
    javaslang
    The javaslang package contains core types like Î», Lazy and Tuple.
    javaslang.collection
    Purely functional collections based on TraversableOnce.
    javaslang.concurrent
    This package contains basic building blocks creating fast, asynchronous, non-blocking parallel code.
    javaslang.control
    Control structures like Match, the disjoint union type Either, the optional value type Option and Try for exception handling.
    javaslang.test
    A property check framework built around Property which integrates well with unit test frameworks like junit.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang 
    Class and Description
    Option
    Replacement for Optional.
    Try
    An implementation similar to Scala's Try control.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang.collection 
    Class and Description
    Option
    Replacement for Optional.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang.concurrent 
    Class and Description
    Option
    Replacement for Optional.
    Try
    An implementation similar to Scala's Try control.
    Try.CheckedRunnable
    A Runnable which may throw.
    Try.CheckedSupplier
    A Supplier which may throw.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang.control 
    Class and Description
    Either
    Either represents a value of two possible types.
    Either.LeftProjection
    A left projection of an either.
    Either.RightProjection
    A right projection of an either.
    Failure.NonFatal
    An unchecked wrapper for non-fatal/recoverable exceptions.
    Left
    The Left version of an Either.
    Match
    Match is a Java switch on steroids (without the negative 'side effects').
    Match.MatchFunction.Otherwise 
    Match.MatchFunction.When 
    Match.MatchFunction.When.Then 
    Match.MatchFunction.WhenApplicable 
    Match.MatchFunction.WhenUntyped
    WhenUntyped is needed, when the return type of the MatchFunction is still unknown, i.e.
    Match.MatchMonad 
    Match.MatchMonad.Of 
    Match.MatchMonad.Otherwise 
    Match.MatchMonad.When 
    Match.MatchMonad.When.Then 
    Match.MatchMonad.WhenApplicable 
    Match.MatchMonad.WhenUntyped 
    None
    None is a singleton representation of the undefined Option.
    Option
    Replacement for Optional.
    Right
    The Right version of an Either.
    Some
    Some represents a defined Option.
    Try
    An implementation similar to Scala's Try control.
    Try.CheckedConsumer
    A Consumer which may throw.
    Try.CheckedFunction
    A Function which may throw.
    Try.CheckedPredicate
    A Predicate which may throw.
    Try.CheckedRunnable
    A Runnable which may throw.
    Try.CheckedSupplier
    A Supplier which may throw.
